Stremio with SSH and Wireguard [closed]

Ask Question
Asked today
Modified today
Viewed 15 times
-1
Closed. This question is not about programming or software development. It is not currently accepting answers.

This question does not appear to be about a specific programming problem, a software algorithm, or software tools primarily used by programmers. If you believe the question would be on-topic on another Stack Exchange site, you can leave a comment to explain where the question may be able to be answered.

Closed 6 mins ago.

Improve this question

Right now I am living in France and have my Raspberry Pi 5 in Spain, and I use Wireguard and ssh to connect to my rasberry pi, I wanted to install Stremio into my rasberry pi and access it remotely using localhost or any other address, but to do this I have to configure it using the graphical interface, so I installed stremio using this git (the official one): https://github.com/Stremio/stremio-shell/blob/master/DEBIAN.md

I also installed XLaunch and connected via ssh with ssh -Y, it works great when I open gedit for example, but when I finally build stremio, it opens stremio, but then it goes dark and displays this error in the terminal:

[29897:1:0913/221835.341593:FATAL:page_allocator_internals_posix.h(169)] Check failed: . : Invalid argument (22)
qml: render process terminated with code 5 and status: 3

PD: I tried to do a docker container with all the stremio info, port... but it said failed to fetch and couldn't find a way to fix it, so I though of this more elaborated way.

I tried updating all packages and reinstalling XLaunch, but nothing worked.

  • bash
  • ssh
  • xlaunch
Share
Improve this question
edited 23 mins ago
David Makogon
70.8k2222 gold badges144144 silver badges192192 bronze badges
asked 28 mins ago
Gonzalo TorrasGonzalo Torras
1
New contributor
Gonzalo Torras is a new contributor to this site. Take care in asking for clarification, commenting, and answering. Check out our Code of Conduct.
1
  • 1
    This is off-topic here, as it's not a programming question. If you're having a specific issue with something related to a repo, you should open an issue on the repo. If it's related to something on Raspberry Pi or Linux, you can post a question to Raspberry Pi or Unix & Linux but... this question would be off-topic there as well, as there really isn't anything pi-specific or Linux-specific.
    – David Makogon
    Commented 22 mins ago
